content: *for round 9 crochet into blo when crocheting into the slip stitches around the neck round s instructions no of stitches 9* chain 8 make these chains tight increase single_crochet 6 <centred single_crochet increase> single_crochet 2 increase single_crochet 27 increase single_crochet 2 <centred single_crochet increase> single_crochet 6 increase 10-13 single_crochet 27 x4 rounds 27 x4 14 single_crochet 1 decrease x9 18 15 decrease single_crochet 5 decrease x 2 single_crochet 5 decrease start stuffing the body now 14 16 decrease x7 7 use a yarn needle to thread through the front loops of the seven single_crochet and pull to close the hole fasten off and hide tail female mallard round s instructions no of stitches 7 single_crochet 7 single_crochet 1 to account for this extra single_crochet you will need to move stitch 7 marker to forward one stitch to mark the new beginning of round stuff neck continue in medium brown 8 chain 8 make these chains tight increase single_crochet 6 <centred single_crochet increase> single_crochet 2 increase single_crochet 27 increase single_crochet 2 <centred single_crochet increase> single_crochet 6 increase 9-12 single_crochet 27 x4 rounds 27 x4 13 single_crochet 1 decrease x9 18 14 decrease single_crochet 5 decrease x 2 single_crochet 5 decrease start stuffing the body now 14 15 decrease x7 7 use a yarn needle to thread through the front loops of the seven single_crochet and pull to close the hole fasten off and hide tail wings start in grey for male and brown for female duck all stitches are in grey male or brown female unless a different colour is specified in brackets after the stitch s first wing second wing round s instructions no of round s instructions no of stitches stitches 1 single_crochet 7 into magic_ring 7 1 single_crochet 7 into magic_ring 7 2 increase x2 last single_crochet of second 16 + 2 2 increase x2 half_double_crochet & double_crochet htc & 16 + 2 increase in white half_double_crochet & double_crochet chains tc & chain 2 & tc & htc chains both in blue htc in final htc in white double_crochet & white & tc & chain 2 & tc & half_double_crochet both in blue increase htc double_crochet & half_double_crochet increase x2 x2 first single_crochet of first increase in white finish with an invisible join into the second stitch of round two for a neat finish alternatively make a slip_stitch to the next stitch the first stitch of round two after creating the wings they will form a rounded oval shape you will need to block the wings to create the pointed shape see below blocking you will need to block the wings to create the pointed wing shape use a blocking mat or a piece of cardboard place two pins on the round edge with the single crochets place a third pin into the top corner of the chain two the furthest corner from the white and blue stitches and pull it out to form a point the two wings should form a mirror image pictured right once
